channel.copyright: © Ilyaas Mayet and Awande Buthelezi - all rights reserved

description.p: Join Ilyaas and Awande (and sometimes Zach too) as they pick apart culture, politics and the latest happenings in human society.
Sometimes they all agree, most of the time they don’t.

channel.itunes:subtitle: Let's talk about it

item.itunes:author: Ilyaas Mayet and Awande Buthelezi | Solid Gold Podcasts
item.title: Health and Fitness in the End Times
item.itunes:title: Health and Fitness in the End Times
item.itunes:subtitle: A little help from the Good Doctor
item.description:
Health and Fitness in the End Times — A little help from the Good Doctor Dr. Nick Mutanda-Musoke We're back with a new season! This week we are joined by Dr Nick Mutanda-Musoke. Dr Mutanda-Musoke, a young doctor, helps us navigate around the benefits and difficulties that come with maintaining our physical health during this period. We also delve into some of the individual successes and failures we have experienced in each of our attempts to be a paragon of health.


When you're ready to #BeHeard, contact the podcast specialists at SolidGold.co.za
item.content:encoded:

item.author: qc@solidgold.co.za (Ilyaas Mayet and Awande Buthelezi | Solid Gold Podcasts)
item.itunes:author: Ilyaas Mayet and Awande Buthelezi | Solid Gold Podcasts
item.title: Rewind... Press Play
item.itunes:title: Rewind... Press Play
item.itunes:subtitle: A short catch up on the year that's been and a preview of what's to come
item.description:
Rewind... Press Play — A short catch up on the year that's been and a preview of what's to come We're back!! In our preview for season 2 of QC: The Podcast, we discuss a relatively boring year thus far and the notable events that have occurred. Awande considers the dangers of the internet and Ilyaas explains how social media pushes conspiracy theories forward. Season 2 of the QC: The Podcast starts 10 August 2020.


When you're ready to #BeHeard, contact the podcast specialists at SolidGold.co.za

item.author: qc@solidgoldstudios.co.za (Ilyaas Mayet and Awande Buthelezi | Solid Gold Podcast Studios)
item.itunes:author: Ilyaas Mayet and Awande Buthelezi | Solid Gold Podcast Studios
item.title: Preview Season
item.itunes:title: Preview Season
item.itunes:subtitle: A look at the 2020 Golden Globe nominees
item.description:
In the final episode of season 1, the QC boys preview the golden globe nominees, debate the which films deserve nominations, which films should have been nominated and other aspects of film culture. Ilyaas and Awande discuss and debate aging actors, award snubs and which actors, directors and films deserve the credit for 2020’s offering of the Golden Globes. If you’re a film fan, this episode is for you!


If you're ready to produce your own podcast, contact the podcast experts at SolidGoldStudios.co.za

item.author: qc@solidgoldstudios.co.za (Ilyaas Mayet and Awande Buthelezi | Solid Gold Podcast Studios)
item.itunes:author: Ilyaas Mayet and Awande Buthelezi | Solid Gold Podcast Studios
item.title: It’s always better with the lights out
item.itunes:title: It’s always better with the lights out
item.itunes:subtitle: A deep dive into a dark year for South Africa
item.description:
In the penultimate episode of 2019, the boys give a brief run through of some of the year's highlights and lowlights (no pun intended). Then they blow off some steam regarding the recent country's power problems, the rise and fall of Ramaphoria, the breakdown of SAA and the general circus that is South Africa. Dweezy also expresses his love for nuts as we gear up for the holidays


If you're ready to produce your own podcast, contact the podcast experts at SolidGoldStudios.co.za

item.title: Don’t let the (wo)man keep you down
item.itunes:title: Don’t let the (wo)man keep you down
item.itunes:subtitle: A deep dive into the underbelly of corporate law
item.description:
We’re back! This week we’re joined by Nonhlanhla Mohlaba, a young attorney, who shares her experiences as a black lawyer navigating the corporate terrain of a top law firm in Johannesburg. She details her time in law and gives advice to any young black women looking to enter the legal sphere.


If you're ready to produce your own podcast, contact the podcast experts at SolidGoldStudios.co.za

item.itunes:author: Ilyaas Mayet and Awande Buthelezi | Solid Gold Podcast Studios
item.title: The Prequel
item.itunes:title: The Prequel
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s origins story from the QC boyz. Better late than never!
item.description:
We’re back! And the full team is finally reunited! In this week’s episode we take a trip down memory lane and explain our collective origins story as well as why we decided to embark on the creation of this channel. Awande and Zach offer anecdotes on debating and picking up girls while Ilyaas explains how Awande got the nickname “consistenty late”


If you're ready to produce your own podcast, contact the podcast experts at SolidGoldStudios.co.za

item.itunes:author: Ilyaas Mayet and Awande Buthelezi | Solid Gold Podcast Studios
item.title: Vague, Contradictory and Nonsensical (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: Vague, Contradictory and Nonsensical (Part 2)
item.itunes:subtitle: A look into the public protector’s road of (wins and) losses
item.description:
In Part 2, we’re rejoined by Tad Khosa and we deconstruct the public protector’s crusade against the president and try to figure out whether or not she’s good enough to keep her job. Awande also shows his love for Mmusi Maimane and we look into different conspiracies surrounding the government.


If you're ready to produce your own podcast, contact the podcast experts at SolidGoldStudios.co.za

item.title: Only God Can Judge Me (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: Only God Can Judge Me (Part 1)
item.itunes:subtitle: A deep dive into the drama that is the office of the Public Protector
item.description:
In part 1, we’re joined by the indomitable Tad Khoza to discuss the public protector, who she is and what she does, her continued public losses in court and whether or not she’s good enough for the job.


Visit the Legal Resources Centre website click here

item.title: Spidey Senses
item.itunes:title: Spidey Senses
item.itunes:subtitle: Where to from here for the MCU?
item.description:
*Spoiler Alert* This week, we discuss the new film, Spider-Man: Far From Home and how it fits into the continuation of the MCU. The QC team look into how the film will contribute to phase 4 of the MCU and speculate on Marvel’s plans to continue to keep its fans glued to screens for years to come.


If you're ready to produce your own podcast, contact the podcast experts at SolidGoldStudios.co.za

item.author: qc@solidgoldstudios.co.za (Ilyaas Mayet and Awande Buthelezi | Solid Gold Podcast Studios)
item.itunes:author: Ilyaas Mayet and Awande Buthelezi | Solid Gold Podcast Studios
item.title: The Sequel
item.itunes:title: The Sequel
item.itunes:subtitle: The State of our Nation
item.description:
In our maiden episode, we look at the State of the Nation Address given by the president of South Africa on 21 June 2019 and discuss and debate whether or not it hit the mark given South Africa's current political climate. Ilyaas and Awande dissect and debate the president's second SONA for the year and decide whether or not anything has been achieved by the government and ponder on whether or not the future is bright for the people of South Africa.


If you're ready to produce your own podcast, contact the podcast experts at SolidGoldStudios.co.za
